title: 02. The First Constitutional Settlement, 27 BCE
description: Augustus’ First Constitutional Settlement and how it balanced Republican tradition with personal power.

questions.question: What impression did Augustus want to give when arranging the First Constitutional Settlement?
options: That he was overthrowing the Senate
That he was reluctantly accepting responsibility

questions.question: Why was it important for Augustus to appear to preserve the Republic?
options: Romans resented individuals with excessive power

questions.question: According to Dio Cassius, what was the political effect of transferring power to Augustus?
options: It avoided the appearance of monarchy

questions.question: What honours were granted to Augustus as part of the First Settlement?
options: Laurel doorposts, Civic Crown, and Shield of Virtue

questions.question: What type of imperium was Augustus granted in 27 BCE?
Which provinces remained under Augustus’ control after the settlement?
What motive does Dio Cassius attribute to Augustus’ control of military provinces?
How were the remaining provinces administered after 27 BCE?
What title did Augustus adopt to emphasise his status as first among equals?
What distinction does the PPT draw between auctoritas and potestas?
options: Auctoritas is legal power, potestas is influence
Auctoritas is influence without office, potestas is official power

questions.question: Why was this balance between auctoritas and potestas necessary?
options: Firm leadership was required but resented

questions.question: How did Augustus respond to suggestions of excessive power?
Which authors support Augustus’ claim that the Republic was restored?
Which authors are sceptical about the restoration of the Republic?
What claim does Augustus make in the Res Gestae about his offices?
options: That he accepted no office against tradition
